00020 #ifndef _DVDRP_H_
00021 #define _DVDRP_H_

00030 static const uint8_t DVDRP_PROTO_ID = 12;
00031 
00033 // Base types needed for packets, route, and forwarding tables.
00035 typedef uint32_t bv_set_t;
00036 typedef uint16_t node_id_t;  
00037                              //between node_id_t and the size of the
00038                              //bv_id in the packets below (a uint8_t),
00039                              //Nodes with ID's higher than 32 will
00040                              //fail strangely if they try and set a
00041                              //predicate currently.  This needs to be
00042                              //fixed with the bv_id arbitration
00043                              //scheme.
00044 
00045 typedef struct dvdrp_attribute_t
00046 {
00047     uint16_t name;
00048     uint16_t value;
00049 } dvdrp_attrib;  //4 bytes
00050 
00051 typedef uint8_t dvdrp_comp_t;
00052 #define DVDRP_COMPARE_LT 1
00053 #define DVDRP_COMPARE_GT 2
00054 #define DVDRP_COMPARE_EQ 3
00055 #define DVDRP_COMPARE_NE 4
00056 
00057 typedef struct dvdrp_constraint_t
00058 {
00059     uint16_t     name;
00060     uint16_t     value;
00061     dvdrp_comp_t compare_type;
00062 } dvdrp_constraint;   //5 bytes
00063 
00064 typedef struct dvdrp_filter_t {
00065     uint8_t           num_constraints;
00066     dvdrp_constraint  constraints[0];
00067 } dvdrp_filter;
00068 
00069 //max numbers for packets
00070 typedef struct dvdrp_predicate_t
00071 {
00072     uint8_t      num_filters;
00073     dvdrp_filter filters[0];
00074 } dvdrp_predicate;
00075 
00077 // DVDRP packet types.  Every packet contains a dvdrp_pkt up top.
00079 typedef struct dvdrp_pkt_t
00080 {
00081     uint8_t       pkt_type;
00082     uint8_t       htl;
00083 } dvdrp_pkt;      //2 bytes
00084 
00085 static const uint8_t DVDRP_MAX_MESG_ATTRIBS = 10;
00086 typedef struct dvdrp_mesg_pkt_t
00087 {
00088     dvdrp_pkt     header;        //2 byte
00089     bv_set_t      split_bv;      //4 bytes (6)
00090     node_id_t     immed_dest;    //2 bytes (8)
00091     uint8_t       is_secondary;  //1 byte  (9)
00092     uint8_t       num_attribs;   //1 byte  (10)
00093     dvdrp_attrib  attributes[0]; //varaible (64 - each attribute is 4
00094                                  //bytes, so a max of 13 or so - lets
00095                                  //say 10)
00096 } __attribute__((packed)) dvdrp_mesg_pkt;
00097 
00098 static const uint8_t DVDRP_MAX_ADVERT_CONSTRAINTS = 8;
00099 static const uint8_t DVDRP_MAX_ADVERT_FILTERS = 4;
00100 typedef struct dvdrp_advertisement_pkt_t
00101 {
00102     dvdrp_pkt        header;      //2 byte
00103     node_id_t        receiver_id; //2 bytes (4)
00104     node_id_t        prev_hop;    //2 bytes (6)
00105     uint8_t          seq_num;     //1 byte  (7)
00106     uint8_t          bv_pos;      //1 byte  (8)
00107     uint32_t         min_delay;   //4 bytes (12)
00108     dvdrp_predicate  pred;        //variable (64 - each constraint is
00109                                   //5 bytes so a max of 8 or so
00110 } __attribute__((packed)) dvdrp_advert_pkt;
00111 
00112 typedef struct dvdrp_req_repair_pkt_t
00113 {
00114     dvdrp_pkt header;      //2 bytes
00115     node_id_t receiver_id; //2 bytes (4)
00116 } dvdrp_req_repair_pkt;
00117 
00118 static const uint8_t DVDRP_MESG_PKT   = 0x1;
00119 static const uint8_t DVDRP_ADVERT_PKT = 0x2;
00120 static const uint8_t DVDRP_REPAIR_PKT = 0x3;
00121 
00123 // Other DVDRP constants
00125 #define DVDRP_RT_MAX_PREDICATES 5
00126 #define DVDRP_RT_MAX_PATHS 2
00127 
00128 //#define DVDRP_MAX_RECEIVERS 32
00129 #define DVDRP_MAX_HTL 20
00130 #define DVDRP_INVALID_NODE_ID 0
00131 #define DVDRP_INVALID_BV_ID 32
00132 
00133 //ioctl types
00134 enum dvdrp_ioctl_t {
00135     DVDRP_IOCTL_SETPRED = 1,
00136     DVDRP_IOCTL_SETFAILURE_LIMIT,   //not impl
00137     DVDRP_IOCTL_RESET_PROTO         //not impl
00138 };

00141 // Memory pools for route tables
00143 typedef struct mem_pool_t {
00144     uint8_t  num_elems;
00145     uint8_t  type_size;
00146     uint32_t free_vec;
00147     void    *pool;
00148 } mem_pool;
00149 
00150 typedef struct dvdrp_constraint_ptr_t {
00151     uint16_t                       name;
00152     uint16_t                       value;
00153     dvdrp_comp_t                   compare_type;
00154     struct dvdrp_constraint_ptr_t *next;
00155 } dvdrp_constraint_list;
00156 
00157 typedef struct dvdrp_filter_ptr_t {
00158     dvdrp_constraint_list     *constraints;
00159     struct dvdrp_filter_ptr_t *next;
00160 } dvdrp_filter_list;
00161 
00162 #define DVDRP_MEM_CONSTRAINTS 20
00163 #define DVDRP_MEM_FILTERS 10
00164 #define DVDRP_MEM_COMBUFS 4
00165 extern mem_pool constraint_pool;
00166 extern mem_pool filter_pool;
00167 extern mem_pool combuf_pool;
00168 
00169 //suggested stack size - keep in mind, we've gotten by with a lot
00170 //less, but if your application is using a decent amount of stack
00171 //space (and you're getting strange behavior) think about using some
00172 //more.  See the DV/DRP docs for more information on stack space
00173 //issues and debugging, particularly mos_get_stack_size(...)
00174 #define DVDRP_SUGGESTED_STACK_SIZE 256
00175 
00176 void dvdrp_init_mem_pools();
00177 void *pool_malloc(mem_pool *pool);
00178 void pool_free(mem_pool *pool, void *mem);
00179 
00181 // Public function prototypes
00183 /* Setup the flooding protocol and register with the net layer. */
00185 void dvdrp_init();
00186 
00187 /* Send a packet using the flooding protocol. */
00192 int8_t dvdrp_send(comBuf *pkt, va_list args);
00193 
00194 /* Receive a packet that came using the dvdrp protocol. */
00195 // NOTE: Must subtract the sizeof route header from pkt->size so
00196 //       the net layer can determine whether any more data is available.
00206 boolean dvdrp_recv(comBuf *pkt, uint8_t **footer, uint8_t port);
00207 
00208 /* Set some protocol specific parameters. */
00213 int8_t dvdrp_ioctl(uint8_t request, va_list args);
00214 
00216 // Some basic bit operations.
00218 
00219 #define mask_set(X, Y) (X |= ((uint32_t)0x0001 << (uint32_t)Y))
00220 #define mask_unset(X, Y) (X &= ~((uint32_t)0x0001 << (uint32_t)Y))
00221 #define mask_query(X, Y) (1 == (((uint32_t)X >> (uint32_t)Y) & (uint32_t)0x0001))
00222 #define mask_clear(X) (X = 0)
00223 
00224 #endif
